detaileddescription.para: Groups can be used to logically hold objects so that they can be individually focused. They are NOT for laying out objects on a screen (try lv_cont for that).

Init. the group module
Internal function, do not call directly.

Create a new object group
pointer to the new object group

Delete a group object
group
pointer to a group

Add an object to a group
group
pointer to a group
obj
pointer to an object to add

Remove an object from its group
obj
pointer to an object to remove

Remove all objects from a group
group
pointer to a group

Focus on an object (defocus the current)
obj
pointer to an object to focus on

Focus the next object in a group (defocus the current)
group
pointer to a group

Focus the previous object in a group (defocus the current)
group
pointer to a group

Do not let to change the focus from the current object
group
pointer to a group
en
true: freeze, false: release freezing (normal mode)

Send a control character to the focuses object of a group
group
pointer to a group
c
a character (use LV_KEY_.. to navigate)
result of focused object in group.

Set a function for a group which will be called when a new object is focused
group
pointer to a group
focus_cb
the call back function or NULL if unused

Set whether the next or previous item in a group is focused if the currently focused obj is deleted.
group
pointer to a group
new
refocus policy enum

Manually set the current mode (edit or navigate).
group
pointer to group
edit
true: edit mode; false: navigate mode

Set the click_focus attribute. If enabled then the object will be focused then it is clicked.
group
pointer to group
en
true: enable click_focus

Set whether focus next/prev will allow wrapping from first->last or last->first object.
group
pointer to group
en
true: wrapping enabled; false: wrapping disabled

Get the focused object or NULL if there isn't one
group
pointer to a group
pointer to the focused object

Get a pointer to the group's user data
group
pointer to an group
pointer to the user data

Get the focus callback function of a group
group
pointer to a group
the call back function or NULL if not set

Get the current mode (edit or navigate).
group
pointer to group
true: edit mode; false: navigate mode

Get the click_focus attribute.
group
pointer to group
true: click_focus is enabled; false: disabled

Get whether focus next/prev will allow wrapping from first->last or last->first object.
group
pointer to group
en
true: wrapping enabled; false: wrapping disabled
